message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms are consistent with an aortic dissection, and hypertension is the strongest predisposing factor for this condition. Other risk factors for aortic dissection include advanced age, connective tissue disorders, and atherosclerosis, but hypertension is the strongest factor in this patient’s case. Diabetes mellitus, age, and history of smoking are also risk factors for cardiovascular disease, but they are not as strongly associated with aortic dissection as hypertension.

While age, smoking, and diabetes can also contribute to cardiovascular disease, hypertension is the strongest predictor in this case.
